result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa Marguerite Venth

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 8:59 AM Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Theresa Marguerite Venth.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to count to misdemeanor possession, 961.41(3g)(d) indicates that defendant will plead to sole count. 6 months jail imposed and stayed for 1 year of probation, $10 fine plus costs, programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, 27 days jail with credit for 27 days, time served. Court amends count 1 to misdemeanor possession, statute 961.41(3g)(d). Defendant pleads guilty to the amended count. Attorney Johannsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds the defendant's plea was knowingly and voluntarily made. Judgment of conviction is entered and defendant is found guilty.
Court orders 6 months jail imposed and stayed for 1 year of probation. Conditions of $10 fine plus costs, programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, 27 days jail with credit for 27 days, time served.
$500 already posted. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Theresa Marguerite Venth. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Defendant did not have a ride to court. Attorney Johansen asks for reinstatement of bond and asks for preliminary hearing waiver. Defendant does not have anything to post.  State agrees with Attorney Johansen and agrees to waiver of preliminary hearing. Defendant and Attorney waive prelim. Johansen feels waiver is knowingly made.

Court reinstates cash bond posted. Court orders additional $500 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth not in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Theresa Marguerite Venth.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant does not appear; Attorney Johansen has no information.
State has no information requests warrant MN/WI and forf bail/bond
Court issues warrant/forf bail bond
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Theresa Marguerite Venth
Current: 820 E 8Th St, Duluth, MN 55805 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2022)
Prior: 820 E 8Th St, Duluth, MN 55811
No use or possession of drugs or paraph.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth appeared by video, in custody. Michael Hoffman for defense
Court quashes warrant
Defendant- Didn't realize it was the first, thought it was the 7th. Went to Safe Haven. Was picked up in Duluth on Monday
State- Reqests $250 cash, vacate forfeiture of signature bond, no drugs or paraph. No prior history
Att Hoffman- no money to post, agrees no prior record
Court orders $500 cash bond, vacates forfeiture of signature bond. Conditions of no drugs or paraph.
State- witness won't be available until 6/29/22 for prelim
Court- no way to meet time limits now, sees limits as waived,  sets for prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:43 AM Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth not in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Theresa Marguerite Venth.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Johansen has no information.
State has no information on defendant's whereabouts.  Request a warrant for WI and MN. Forfeit any bail/bond. 
Court notes signed notice in file; issues warrant and forfs any bail/bond
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Marguerite Venth appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Reid appeared in Court with Defendant Theresa Venth. Attorney Reid received complaint and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $2,000 signature bond with condition of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  . Defendant has no criminal history that was found. Attorney Reid has no objection. Court orders $2,000 signature bond with condition of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
